resources.string: Customize how Scanium looks, scans, and protects your data.

Scanium is built and maintained independently. If the app helps you save time or money, you can support its development by buying me a coffee. Every contribution helps keep the app improving â€” thank you!
Your donation helps keep Scanium improving and covers running costs.

Scanium needs camera access to scan and catalog items in your environment.
Point at items to identify and catalog them
Start continuous scanning (tap again to stop)
ðŸ”’ All processing happens on your device. Images are never uploaded without your permission.
Select your preferred language for the app
You\'re all set to start scanning and cataloging objects. Happy scanning!
Let\'s take a quick tour of the main features:
View all your scanned items in an organized list
Select items and export them for other apps
Get pricing and export help from the AI assistant
Customize settings and preferences from the menu
Let\'s take a quick tour to learn the camera controls.
Tap here to capture an item.
Switch between front and rear camera.
Tap the shutter button to take a photo of your first item. Point your camera at any object you want to catalog.
Tap here to open your scanned items list. The badge shows how many items you\'ve captured.
Capture additional angles or details. Multiple photos help buyers see your item better and improve AI descriptions.
Fill in brand, type, color, size, and other attributes. Better details mean better listings and faster sales.
Let AI create a professional marketplace description using your photos and attributes. Get pricing insights too!
Tap Save to keep your changes. Your item will be ready for export.
Select items and tap the share button to export them as images, text, or a ZIP bundle for listing platforms.
You\'re all set to scan, catalog, and sell your items. Happy scanning!
Center an object here to scan it.
Move a bit farther if detection is unstable.
Tap to capture your first item.
Tap here to capture an item.
Switch between front and rear camera.
Tap an item to edit details before selling.
Select items, then share or export to sell.
Improve details to get better listings.
Set condition and price for better results.
Use AI to generate a ready-to-sell description.
Set your language once â€” AI and voice follow it.
You can replay this guide anytime.
Scanium is a camera-first application that uses machine learning to detect and identify objects in real-time, helping you value and list items for resale.

Export to spreadsheets, chat apps, or marketplaces.

Review your scanned items. Tap one to edit or long-press to manage multiple.

Confirming will mark this as verified.
Items without AI-generated descriptions will use fallback text and be marked as \'NEEDS_AI\' in the export.
Generate a compelling title, description, and bullet points for your listing.

Object detected outside scan zone. Center it for better results.
No objects detected. Try pointing at prominent items.

Camera access has been disabled for Scanium. To scan and catalog items, please enable camera access in your device settings.
Scanium uses your camera to detect and catalog objects in your environment.
ðŸ”’ All processing happens locally on your device. Images are never uploaded without your permission.
First launch requires downloading\nML Kit object detection models (~15 MB)
Classification will use on-device processing until SCANIUM_API_BASE_URL is configured.
Select an item to generate a listing
This suggestion has lower confidence. Do you want to apply it anyway?
Like new condition with minimal signs of use

Most of Scanium's processing happens directly on your phone:

- Object detection runs locally using ML Kit
- Barcode and text recognition are fully on-device
- Camera frames are processed in memory and discarded immediately
- No data leaves your device unless you explicitly enable cloud features

When enabled in Settings:

- What is sent: Cropped thumbnail images of detected items only (not full camera frames)
- When it is sent: Only for stable items that need enhanced classification
- Where it is processed: Scanium backend + Google Cloud Vision API
- Privacy measures: EXIF metadata is stripped, images are not stored permanently

Toggle: Settings -> Cloud Classification

When enabled in Settings:

- What is sent: Your question text + item context (category, attributes, condition)
- Images: Only sent if you enable 'Send Images to Assistant' (off by default)
- Where it is processed: Scanium backend -> AI provider (provider-agnostic)
- Privacy measures: Raw prompts are not logged, device ID is hashed

Toggles:
- Settings -> Assistant Features
- Settings -> Send Images to Assistant

When enabled in Settings:

- Microphone: Only active when you press the mic button (never always-on)
- Speech-to-Text: Processed using Android's built-in speech recognition (on-device where available)
- Audio storage: Audio is NOT stored or uploaded by default
- Text-to-Speech: Responses can be spoken aloud using on-device TTS

Toggles:
- Settings -> Voice input (microphone)
- Settings -> Read assistant replies aloud
- Settings -> Auto-send after voice recognition (optional)

When enabled in Settings:

- What is collected: Anonymous crash reports, app performance metrics
- What is NOT collected: Raw prompts, OCR text, audio, images, API keys
- PII redaction: Personal data is automatically redacted
- Purpose: Help us fix bugs and improve app stability

Toggle: Settings -> Share Diagnostics (off by default)

- We do not access your contacts, calendar, or other personal data
- We do not track your location
- We do not store raw audio recordings
- We do not log your questions or OCR text
- We do not sell your personal data to third parties
All cloud features are opt-in. You can toggle them at any time in Settings. Use \'Privacy Safe Mode\' to quickly disable all cloud data sharing with one tap.
Scanning for barcodes and QR codes
Detailed LiveScan logs enabled (Logcat tag: LiveScan)
Shows bbox mapping info: rotation, scale, dimensions (Logcat tag: GeomMap)
Validates bbox AR matches crop AR (Logcat tag: CORR)
Filters which bboxes are drawn on camera overlay. Does not affect detection or aggregation.
Writes outgoing classifier crops to cache (cleared on uninstall)
Adds extra classifier details to Logcat (debug builds only)
Send test event to Sentry (handled exception)
Always show tour on app launch (debug only)
Draw spotlight outlines and center line
Diagnostics & checks help verify connectivity to your backend services (health, config, preflight, assistant) and alert you when something breaks. Use them while testing to quickly spot disruptions.
Granted - Background monitor can send notifications
Permission needed for background health monitor notifications
Notifications for background monitoring errors in DEV builds
Endpoint Not Found (check base URL / tunnel route)
